title: As an MNC Admin, I want to see a AFL data displayed in the MN Payroll Player Breakdown
custom_preconds:
AC:

* In the Training Period drop down in the Breakdown section of the MN Payroll Utility, Arizona Fall League will be a new option (dates will be taken from system dates)
* The rest of this section will work consistently with the other options in that dropdown
** Selecting a player
** Displaying a table 
*** Calcs to be covered in a future story
** Updating dates

title: As a MNC Admin, I want EBIS to calculate MN Payroll for players assigned to the Arizona Fall League
custom_preconds:
Context: Players will be assigned to the AFL using the Offseason Assignment transaction.  Once assigned, players will be paid through the end of the season.  If they're injured and leave, they'll still be paid through the end of the season. 

AC:

* Players will be paid the AA In-Season rate for each day they are assigned to the AFL
* AFL Days will start counting at the latter of the following:
** Assignment Date on the Offseason Assignment TX
** First Game of AFL season (season dates)
* Days will stop counting at the conclusion of the Fall League season (Last Playoff date)
* These calculations will be reflected in the 3 sections of the MN Payroll utility and in the MN Payroll widget on player profiles

Notes:

* 40-Man players that are assigned to the AFL should not appear in the MN Payroll Utility
* Outrighted player should be displayed in the MN Payroll Utility

title: As a BOC Admin, I want a Warning Message when a Club adds a Position Player as a 27th Man
custom_preconds:
AC:

* When a Club adds a position player as a 27th Man, an Warning message should appear:
* Title: Warning
* Message:  "As a reminder, MLR 2(b)(2)(A)(viii) states that "the 27th Player shall not count toward the maximum of 13 pitchers on the Active List". Please keep in mind that since you are adding a position player as an Additional Player, you cannot exceed the 13 pitcher limit during the doubleheader."
* Buttons: Ignore & Continue, Back

title: As a BOC User, I want to send a player memo via Text
custom_preconds:
AC:
 - When a player memo is sent, EBIS will send the memo to all players via Text using the MLB Official Contact Info
 - Deliveries and failures will be logged and available for download

title: Convert Waiver Request, Result, and Transaction Bulletin Printing to Screen Shots
custom_preconds: Update all three bulletins (Waiver Request, Waiver Results, and Transaction) so they use the screen shot service, rather than BO when printing.

title: As a MNC Admin, I want a new Player Type column in the Add C widget
custom_preconds:
Context:  The population of the Add C widget no longer contains all player requiring an Add C.  Only certain types of players will be included.  A new column is needed to display why the player is included.

AC:

* There will be a new "Player Type" column in the Add C widget
** On the Club widget, this column will +replace+ the SM Consent column
** On the BOC widget, this column will appear to the left of the Club column
* Possible values for this column are:
** Attach. 43
** Off-season Option / Outright
** In-Season Option / Outright
** DSL
** Multi-year Non-FY
** Needs MNC

title: As a MNC Admin, I want EBIS to automatically create CBA Cs
custom_preconds:
AC:

* There will be a new batch that will be run in early January that creates Add Cs for all standard "CBA Cs"
* These new "Cs" will be created in Approved state (will not need to be tendered or submitted)
* The salaries used will be dictated by the CBA
* These players and Add Cs, will +*not*+ be displayed in the Add C widget



Definition of CBA C: Anyone on a first year contract that isn't under DSL, optioned, or outrighted.

title: EBIS React - Style new React left nav, top nav, and main content pane so they look identical to the existing Angular UI
custom_preconds: Create an outer navigation layer for EBIS in React that mimicks the existing Angular navigation along the sides and top of the UI application.  6

title: As a BOC Admin, I want Players to be removed from Outright when their MJC Expires
custom_preconds:
AC:

* When a player with a status of MJ Roster Status of Outrighted has their MJC expired by the MJC Expiration Batch, the system will create a new "Remove From Outright" transaction
* This transaction will remove the players MJ roster status
* This transaction will use REMOUTRT as a code

title: As a MNC Admin, I want Clubs warned from when Transferring Players FROM the DSL
custom_preconds:
Related to: [https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1696|https://baseball.atlassian.net/browse/PIVOTAL-1696|smart-link] 



AC:

* When a transfer transaction that will move a player from the DSL to a Domestic Affiliate is submitted, the system will return a warning:
** Title: Warning
** Body: Upon approval, this player will begin counting against the Domestic Reserve List.  Do you wish to continue?
** Buttons: Continue, Back
* There will no longer be a hard error on transfers from DSL to Domestic Affiliates
* Transfers between DSL Clubs will continue to not have any warning

title: Break glass login to bypass Okta
custom_preconds:
*As a* BOC Draft Admin

*I want* to be able to login to EBIS without using Okta

*So that* I can still run the draft in EBIS in case of an Okta outage



*Acceptance Criteria*

* Navigating to [https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/admin-login|https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/admin-login] displays a login form with Username/Password inputs
* A database table exists in ebis that allows developers to enter temporary allowed "break glass" username/password combos
* Attempting to login to admin-login sends the credentials using Basic authentication and validates the username/password combo against the db
** On invalid creds, show an error message
** On valid creds, authorize as the specified user and forward to the ebis home page
* Subsequent requests after login use Basic authentication and validate credentials against the database on every request
** Invalid credentials result in a 401 response, which should redirect the user back to the normal [https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/login|https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/login] page
* On successful okta login through [https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/login|https://ebisdev.mlb.com/ebisui/login], admin login credentials are cleared and Okta access token is used again



*Technical notes*

* passwords should be stored encrypted
* angular (and eventually, react) apps should use localStorage['ebis-auth-store'] to store basic auth credentials. ebis-auth-store json object should only ever have either the basicAuthCredentials or the accessToken/idToken/refreshToken so that itâ€™s unambiguous which the http interceptor should use, however, if both are somehow present, favor the accessToken.

Provide architectural documentation to describe the implemention for InfoSec

title: As a MNC Admin, I want to see AFL data displayed in the MN Payroll widget on Player Profiles
custom_preconds:
AC:

* In the MN Payroll widget of the Contracts tab on Pro Player Profiles, there will be a new "AFL" column and a new "AFL Days(x)" column
* The new columns will appear between the Post Season and Fall Training columns
* The AFL values will appear on the AA affiliate row

title: As an MNC Admin, I want to see a AFL data displayed in the MN Payroll Player Summary
custom_preconds:
AC:

* When viewing the Player Summary on the MN Payroll utility, there will be a new "AFL" column and a new "AFL Days(x)" column
* The new columns will appear between the Post Season and Fall Training columns
* The parent row will show the total amount due to player participating in the AFL, and the number of days they were assigned to the AFL
* When the Player's Row is expanded, no data will be displayed for the AFL (consistent with other training periods

title: As an MNC Admin, I want to see a AFL data displayed in the MN Payroll Org Summary
custom_preconds:
Context: Players will get paid the AA in-season rate when in the Arizona Fall League

AC:

* When viewing the Org Summary on the MN Payroll utility, there will be a new "AFL" column
* The new column will appear between the Post Season and Fall Training columns
* The parent row will show the total amount due to player participating in the AFL
* When the Org row is expanded, the AFL team will not be displayed.  The Org's AA club will have values in the AFL column

title: Configure ebis applications to start up without Okta
custom_preconds:
*As a* ebis developer

*I want* to be able to start ebis when OKTA is not running and use the break glass login only

*Acceptance Criteria*

* All ebis applications are able to start up when OKTA is down
* A configuration value exists to enable/disable okta authentication
